DOC.detailed_description: There exponential rise prevalence type 2 diabetes obesity Singapore coincident rapid nutritional socioeconomic transition . Differing birth weight , even normal range , predispose individual risk type 2 diabetes obesity . We aim examine causal pathway , developmental contribution effect weight loss intervention differential evaluate hypothesis genomic , birth weight , developmental , lifestyle environmental factor contribute variation phenotype observe adult obesity metabolic syndrome . Although many large study examine effect birth weight expression obesity metabolic syndrome phenotype , study usually lack in-depth physiological epigenetic/genomic study due large sample size . We therefore aim explore detailed aspect physiological epigenetic/genomic profile small statistically power sample , focus evaluate body composition , nutritional metabolic phenotype relationship epigenetic/genetic marker developmental history . In addition , examine effect weight loss intervention parameter . This assist weigh importance developmental genetic pathway contribute individual risk response efficacy intervention .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Ability give inform consent 2 . Chinese male ( aged 2140 ) 3 . Body mass index 2330 kg/m2 4 . Total body fat content > 24 % 5 . Sedentary adult < 1 episode exercise > =30 min/week 6 . Birth weight 595 % percentile 7 . Fasting glucose < 7 mmol/L 8 . Normotensive , define BP < 140/90 mmHg antihypertensive agent 1 . Recent change weight > 5 % past 6 month 2 . Attempts lose weight ( weight stable , exercise still change maintenance phase ) past 6 month 3 . Significant change diet past 6 month 4 . Any use weight reduce drug past 6 month 5 . Previous abdominal surgery ( bariatric surgery ) 6 . Any bleeding disorder would preclude biopsy 7 . Any use investigational drug past 6 month 8 . Known allergy insulin local anaesthetic 9 . Known allergy milk milk product ( eg . Ensure , liquid meal ) 10 . Any serious illness require hospitalization surgery past 6 month 11 . Treatment medication hypertension , diabetes mellitus dyslipidemia , epilepsy , ischemic heart disease 12 . On antiplatelet agent , nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) anticoagulants 13 . Use prescription medication safely discontinue within 14 day prior study entry 14 . Any use corticosteroid past 6 month 15 . Any medication could alter insulin resistance 16 . History surgery metallic clip , staple stent 17 . Presence cardiac pacemaker foreign body part body include tattoos 18 . Mother longer alive unable provide information birth weight 19 . Born premature ( ie . full term baby < 37 week gestation age )
